reviews.review: Very VERY VERY VERY VERY nice game :DD
Gordon dobry ziomek

Классика шутеров, причем не тупых постоянных стрелялок типа Dooma или первых Serious Sam, где надо замочить как можно больше монстров, а с претензией на сюжет и избирательность.
В игре представлено большое количество ландшафтных планов и естественных укрытий (есть возможность убивать врагов "в пятку", но с другой стороны иногда сам не понимаешь откуда в тебя летят смертоносные пули).
Игра не сложна, при игре на среднем уровне достаточно реально пройти ее до конца без ежеминутных самосохранений и возвратов к последней репликации после очередного убийства врагами человечества.
В общем - для любителей шутеров самое то, но поскольку игра все же старая, надо обязательно проверить чтобы операционная система позволяла устанавливать и запускать данную игру.

Gordon, PUH-LEEEEEAAAAAZE be my college professor!!!

[h1] Serious Review: (+ = Pros, - = Cons)
-------------------------------------------------------------- [/h1]
+ First FPS game to fully incorporate a Narrative-Driven story (as opposed to the industry standard of maze gallery shooters which was the Wolfenstein 3D / Doom mechanic).
- Perpetual sprint with optional walking by pressing “Shift” (as opposed to today's standard which is the reverse).
+ Excellent level designs.
+ Realistic combat mechanics (may be not as realistic now, but in 1998, it was).
- Melee weapon needs to be equipped rather than bound to a hotkey (though CS:GO players won't have a problem with this).
+ Fun puzzles.
- No objective tracker (players may forget what they were doing especially if they haven't played in a while).
+ Great sound effects.
+ First FPS game to incorporate scripted sequences for its level transitions rather than cut-scenes.
+ Relatively (and surprisingly) advanced AI (back in 1998), with enemies actively dodging, tactically retreating and often times baiting you into an ambush (literally, there is a point in the game where you get knocked out).
+ Fun fast-paced multiplayer action that set the foundations for Counter-Strike which started as a just a mere mod of Half-Life.
+ Mods; although Half-Life is not the first video game to be modded, it is the first to have several such mods become their own full games that still retain their Half-Life heritage.
+ Challenging difficulty modes (but this is a given since most old-school shooters were challenging).

[h1] Conclusion: 10/13 - "Masterpiece" [/h1]

Half-Life is well, quite possibly one of the best FPS games ever created. This was my favorite game during my childhood which led into Counter-Strike. Coupled with great action, detailed environments and an awesome sci-fi story nothing beats Half-Life. After all these years it's still an awesome game and is a joy to play in super high resolution and also with the included HD textures. Everyone needs to play Half-Life at least once in their lifetime, you won't be disappointed with an unforgettable story and protagonist - Gordon Freeman.

Muß man noch etwas zu "Half-Life" sagen? Zum großartigen Klassiker, zum Genrekönig seiner Zeit, zum Meilenstein der Spielgeschichte?

Eigentlich nicht, und doch versuche ich es. "Half-Life" ist ein linearer, storygetriebener First-Person-Shooter. Wir sind Gordon Freeman, theoretischer Physiker und Mitarbeiter im Labor für anomale Materie des geheimen Forschungskomplexes Black Mesa. Ein Experiment läuft gehörig schief und ein Portal zu einer anderen Welt wird geöffnet. Die Wesen, die in unsere Welt eindringen sind andersartig und feindlich...

Allein schon der Anfang ist unvergeßlich. Wir werden in einer Art Schwebebahn durch die riesige Forschungsanlage gefahren. Wir schauen uns um, sehen riesige Gänge, andere Mitarbeiter, Sicherheitspersonal, arbeitende Lastenroboter, einen merkwürdigen Mann im dunklen Anzug mit Aktenkoffer. Durchsagen geleiten unseren Weg. Ein Vorratscontainer verliert radioaktive Flüssigkeit. Die Welt um uns lebt, auch ohne uns. Sie ist wahr. Diese etwa fünfminütige Sequenz gehört zu den großen Passagen der Spielegeschichte.

Die Welt, die "Half-Life" (zu deutsch: Halbwertszeit) erschafft ist erstaunlich real, die dadurch erzeugte Atmosphäre herausragend. Und das auch heute noch, auch wenn die Grafik nun klobig und verwaschen wirkt, auch wenn die Sprachausgabe quäkt und die Sprecher manchmal schwach sind. Und dabei vergißt "Half-Life" auch nicht die Ironie, den weisen Blick auf sich selbst, die Reflektion über das eigene Produkt. Soviel Souveränität ist selten.

Neben diesem Wesentlichen funktioniert (fast) alles perfekt. Die Bedienbarkeit ist extrem gut und flüssig, die Waffenauswahl vielseitig, insbesondere die faszinierend designeten Alienwaffen überraschen und das Brecheisen ist schlichtweg legendär. Auch Rätsel- und Jumppassagen sind richtig gut gebaut. 

Überhaupt das Leveldesign. Derart viel Abwechslung vermißt man heute fast in allen AAA-Titeln. Die Stupidität der meisten heutigen Main-Stream-Shooter sind ein deutlicher Rückschritt im Vergleich zu "Half-Life". 

Gibt es auch Negatives? Kaum. Lediglich die letzten Passagen, die Alienwelt, wird, trotzdem das Design klasse ist, gameplaytechnisch merkwürdig und teils auch nervig. 

Die Grafik war 1998 herausragend, die Musik grandios atmosphärisch. Wer auf verbesserte Grafik wert legt, sollte sich vielleicht die Source-Version zulegen. Wer das Original erleben will, bleibt bei dieser Version. Auch der Umfang überzeugt, 10 Stunden und mehr ist man leicht in dieser außergewöhnlichen Welt gefangen.

Es gebe noch so Vieles zu berichten und zu loben, aber statt weiter diesen Text zu lesen, sollte man es lieber (wieder einmal) spielen und erleben.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
10/10 Atmosphäre
10/10 Story
9/10 Grafik
9/10 Sound
9/10 Spielmechanik
8/10 Balancing
10/10 Spielspass
(Wertungen von Klassikern beziehen immer die technischen Möglichkeiten der Zeit mit ein)

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Wer Gordon Freeman nicht kennt, sollte sich nicht Gamer nennen.

[h1][b]9/10 Gesamtwertung

Short version: good, but probably not as good as you've heard. Still get it

Long version: It's a well-made game, and it's very clever in terms of the gameplay (i.e. boss fights are a bit more complicated than in most games, you have to think around the location of the fight, not the "health" of the boss persay). The graphics are as good as they need to be, they may seem a bit dated, but they're still good. Really, my only problem with this game is that it's very gimmicky and way overhyped (I could say the same about half-life 2). Is it a great shooter? yes. One of the best of it's era? Sure. The best shooter ever? God no! I personally enjoyed games like doom and Bioshock more, because they don't try to skirt around the fun of shooting things with how "groundbreaking" they are get in the way of their fun. 

General pros and Cons:

Pros:
+ It's a good shooter
+ well-done setpieces that involve the player
+ Great worldbuilding
+ Good piece of gaming history
+ Varied and interesting gamplay

Cons:
- Slow paced
- Unfair at times
- Breeds a fanbase prone to overhyping it

Worth the purchase on sale or bundled with the expansions

Время, друзья, все-таки летит очень быстро. Мы тут прикинули и пришли в некоторое замешательство: с момента выхода первого Half-Life прошло — ни много ни мало — почти шесть лет. Блин, практически целая эпоха. С тех пор появились сотни игр, которые хотели быть “как Half-Life”, “лучше, чем Half-Life” или хотя бы “не хуже Half-Life”. Были, конечно, и такие, которые Half-Life упорно игнорировали, но... вы хоть что-нибудь о них помните?
    Half-Life стал главным мессией и революционером последнего десятка лет, нашим Христом, Лениным, Че Геварой и пророком Магометом. Такие не особенно глобальные, в общем-то, изобретения, как скриптовые сценки, голливудский сюжет и талантливый дизайн в один день сделали Half-Life живым культом, а веселого карлсона Гейба Ньювелла — миллионером.
Yea, you can occasionally get stuck inside pipes, but I prefer this (w/ Super Definition pack from the PS2 edition) to HL: Source. Plus, it's 400MB vs 4GB.

The greatest video game I have ever, and continue, to have the pleasure of playing. Half Life 2 is objectively the better game when it comes to scope, atmosphere, sound, design and writing but the original Half Life is slightly better to me because of it's fast-paced gameplay and much more rewarding replay value. It's become a hobby to just speed-run this game in one sitting. It breaks my heart how far Valve has fallen, and I just hope one day they can really pull themselves up again and release god-tier masterpieces like this again. I mean, they did it with Half Life: Alyx, so that just shows when they want, they can make a great game.

[h1]FPS 게임 계의 새로운 출발을 알렸던 혁신적인 작품[/h1]

평점 : 7/10
플레이타임 : 10~12h

장점
+출시 당시의 혁신성
+다양한 스테이지들과 긴밀하게 잘 이어진 짜임. 구성
+몰입이 쉬움.
+잘 짜여진 레벨 디자인. 난이도가 상승곡선을 그리는 것이 매우 안정적임.
+조작도 그리 어려운 게 아니라 쉽게 즐길 수 있음.

단점
- 3D멀미.
- 불친절한 설명
- 보스들의 패턴이 단순.
- 적들의 다양성이 적음.
- 캐릭터가 자주 끼임. 
- 왜 있는 지 모를 빈약한 동료 시스템
- 사냥과 길찾기의 반복

나왔던 당시에 순풍적인 인기를 끌었던 하프라이프1입니다. 지금의 FPS를 만드는 데 일조한 작품 중 하나입니다. 뭐 지금에 와서는 약간 진부하게 느껴질 수 있습니다.
왜냐면 하프라이프에 쓰였던 것들이 최근 신작들에 다 들어가 있으니까요.
하지만 그런걸 감안해도 충분히 재미있는 작품입니다. 저도 하기전엔 옛날작품인데다 그래픽도 안좋아서 잠깐 하다 말겠지 했는데 게임 내용물이 매우 알차서 시간가는 줄 모르고 플레이했습니다. 이런걸 보면 게임을 구성하는데 그래픽이 꼭 중요한 요소는 아니란걸 깨닫게 해줍니다.
물론 이 그래픽에 적응못하시는 분들도 계실겁니다. 그때는 하프라이프를 밸브가 아닌 다른곳에서 리메이크한 블랙메사를 해보시길 바랍니다.

우선 스토리부터 말씀드리자면, 흔히들 스토리가 명작이라고 하는데 사실 하프라이프1에는 스토리가 별로 없습니다. 되게 직관적인 스토리밖에 없습니다. 그래서 스토리는 사실 중요한 요소는 아닙니다.
이 게임은 스토리가 흘러가는 와중에도 컷신을 극도로 자제한 작품인데, 이 탓에 뭔가 자신이 작품 내에 있다는 기분이 들게 만듭니다. 이는 환경음을 많이 사용한 사운드와 시너지를 일으킵니다.

게임성도 현대에 와서도 전혀 꿀리지 않습니다. 매 스테이지 스테이지마다 특색이 확고한데다가 좀 지루해질 시점이면 새로운 요소가 등장합니다. 괜히  명작이라 불리는게 아닙니다.

다만 이런 게임이라고 단점이 아예 없는 건 아닌데,

첫 번째는 3D 멀미인데, 여지껏 3D 멀미 겪어본 적 없다가 이번 작 하다가 초반부에 한 번 심하게 걸렸습니다. 이런 상태로 게임을 계속 해야되나 싶은 마음으로 3시간하다가 꺼버렸습니다. 다만, 이후에는 적응이 되었는 지 멀미 없이 진행했습니다.

두 번째는 불친절한 설명.
하프라이프에서는 대부분의 퍼즐들이 전부 직관적입니다. 전부 플레이어가 알아서 " 이건 이거구나 저건 저거구나 "해야됩니다. 너무 친절한 건 독이 되지만 너무 불친절한 것도 독이 됩니다. 제 플레이시간은 굉장히 헤매서 22시간이 나온 건데, 대표적으로 동그랗게 생긴 포탈타고 위쪽으로 가는 것과 Xen에 도착한 뒤에 포탈을 타기 위해 했던 생명체를 버섯(?)위에 올리는 것. 불친절한 설명 때문에 길찾기도 상당히 어려운 부분이였던 것 같기도 하네요. 마지막 보스도 뭔지 잘 몰라서 많이 죽었던 것 같기도 하고 말이에요.

세 번째로는 자주 낑긴다는 점인데
이 때문에 세이브를 많이 말아먹었습니다.

그리고 장점이 될 수도 있고 단점이 될 수도 있는데, 바로 조작감인데
고든이 아주 스케이딩 보드탄 것마냥 미끄러지듯 움직이는데 전 뭔가 적응이 되어서 편했지만 몇몇 분들은 상당히 불편해하시는 것 같더라고요. 잘 생각해보시는 게 좋을 듯 싶네요. 조작감은 게임 평생 짊어지고 갈 부분이니까요.

상기한 단점이 있음에도, 하프라이프는 옛 작품치고는 상당한 매력을 지녔고, 아직도 할만한 게임입니다. 한번쯤 경험해보시는 게 좋습니다. 그래픽때문에 적응 안되시면 블랙 메사를 고려해보는걸 추천합니다.

이제 2에서 다시 빠루 만지러 가야겠습니다.

Valven tekemä erittäin hyvä peli!. Grafiikat aika semi vanhat :D ja tarina on täynnä vaaroja ja aivopähkinöitä. Aseet on tosi tehokkaita ja uusiakin aseita voi löytää. Um dos melhores jogos de FPS. Sério.

Esse foi um daqueles primeiros jogos que eu joguei, e é um dos únicos que eu ainda jogo até hoje. Half-Life não se tornou só um jogo pra mim, mas também como virou uma fonte de diversão. Joguei sozinho, joguei com amigos, joguei todos os mapas talvez, joguei o Blue Shift e o Opposing Force e descobri por que esse é um dos melhores jogos que existem.

You are Gordon Freeman, a young research associate in the Anomalous Materials Laboratory. You have limited security clearance and no real idea of just how dangerous your job has become, until the morning you are sent alone into the Test Chamber to analyze a strange crystalline specimen. A routine analysis, they tell you. Until something goes wrong. In this legendary FPS, players enlist the help of traumatized scientists and trigger-happy security guards to get through high-security zones, sneaking and fighting your way through ruined missile silos and Cold War cafeterias, through darkened airducts and subterranean railways. When you finally come in sight of the surface, you realize that the inhuman monsters aren't your only enemies-for the government has sent in ruthless troops and stealthy assassins. Their orders seem to be that when it comes to the Black Mesa, nothing gets out alive... and especially not you.



10/10

i appsolutely love this game...one of my all time favorites no doubt.

I now realize why Half-Life is one of the greatest games of all time. The game kicks off with a mysterious introduction to the Black Mesa Research Compound via rail car. You are introduced to the main protaganist that you play as - Gordon Freeman. Of course silent protaganists were really big back in early chapter based FPS games, it's kind of refreshing though because you can give Gordon any personality you can imagine. Once you get on the advanced HEV suit, you go to do a science test with a mysterious crystal that you know nothing about. Gordon pushes the crystal into a laser and all hell breaks loose. The crystal causes a portal to open from the border world Xen where various alien creatures slip through and attack the Black Mesa Research Compound. From there you travel throughout Black Mesa searching for a solution to the alien invasion. This game is old school, it does not hold your hand at all. You are going to have to search levels for supplies and solutions to various puzzles. Save often, because this game is a process of trial and error at certain points. The gameplay is fast and exhilerating. The Gold Source engine feels amazing, responsive, and tight. The game is also a decent challenge, mainly because it does not hold your hand at all. You need to use different tactics for different enemies, which adds extra variety to the game. There are a few bugs though, I got stuck on walls a lot while bunny hopping to avoid enemies, and one section of the game just did not work properly, so I had to no clip because I did not want to restart the chapter. Half-Life is a classic, if you have not played it yet, I highly suggest you do. The game stills holds up today and has a unique environment, besides the graphics.
TLDR: Half-Life is a classic and exhilerating experience, despite a few annoying bugs. Highly suggest playing the game from start to finish.
